challengeName: HP Product Inventory - REST and Web App Support for Multiple Sites
detailedRequirements:
Recently Topcoder has developed an Product Inventory Audit Web Application.  First we developed a web crawler to pull the raw html from the site, and data extraction processes to parse data and put information into the Vertica database platform.  We've also developed a REST API which allows clients to access the data in JSON format over HTTP and the first client for this service - a Product Inventory Audit Web application.  HP is finding the extracted data quite useful and would like to expand the scope of the application.

We are developing in parallel the Amazon and Best Buy Product Data Retriever, which adds support to the crawler and data extraction applications for more sites. This means we will have data in the database from 3 sites: HP, Amazon and Best Buy.

In this challenge we need to update the REST API and the Web Application to support product data information from Amazon and Best Buy sites, and to modify the existing REST API application to support the modified schema.

  1.  We'll provide the existing schema file for the current data model and the new schema which supports saving product prices and product reviews from multiple sites. We will also provide files with the current database product information, so that you may rebuild the database, and we'll provide conversion scripts, to convert the database to the new schema format.
  2. Update the REST API application to support the modified schema. The current application supports only one price and one set of reviews (for the default HP site). The application must support prices for different sites and reviews for different sites. Do not break existing functionality. Keep in mind that the application suffered a few modifications, so please ask if some features are not clear.
  3. Update the Web application to support prices for different sites and reviews for different sites. The current application supports only one price and one set of reviews (for the default HP site). The application must function properly with the REST API that you also must modify.
    1. Modify the /dashboard page
      1. Should contain a mini-table for each Rating and for each Price value in the table. The mini-table will contain the name of the site on the first column, and the value on the second column. Make the columns left-aligned. Sort option should function based on the average value for Rating, and based on the minimum value for Price.  A sample image of the mini-table for the pricing can be found in the forums.
      2. Also add a combo-box to display values for All or only one site. Default is All. If a site is selected, the page should be displayed as it is now.
    2. Modify the /search page
      1. Should contain a mini-table for each Rating and for each Price value in the table, similar to /dashboard.
      2. The Rating and Price filters should apply to any site.
    3. ���Modify the /product-detail page
      1. Should contain horizontal boxes, one for each price section (striked + current). Display the site name above the price section. Use a border similar to the photos' border, to make the boxes stand out.

Vertica DB Server:

You can download a community edition of Vertica directly from HP:  http://www.vertica.com/.   You simply sign in for a free developer account.   However, a direct Vertica installation requires a Unix/Linux server.  The more straightforward way to standup Vertica is to use VMWare.  VMWare also has free trials available.  A server image can be found at my.vertica.com.  But Topcoder is providing a recent disk image file for Vertica at the following link.  This is a large download (~2 GB).  Also attached to this challenge on Vertica/VMWare set up instructions.

https://drive.google.com/file/d/0ByjxTGykXQjAWkkwTWUzcXJucjQ/view?usp=sharing

JDBC Jar files for Vertica can be found here:

http://www.vertica.com/resources/vertica-client-drivers/

Final Notes:

The applications should be extendable to support other sites.

The winner must fix the Required comments from Review.
finalSubmissionGuidelines:
• Upload all your source code in a zip file.
  • Provide documentation for your application. It should contain complete build, deployment, and execution instructions.
  • Screen sharing video is not required for this application.
